headline: LA Rams celebrate Super Bowl win with Las Vegas bash
author: Francesca Bacardi
sentences: We’re told Rams players Tyler Higbee, Brian Allen, Troy Reeder, Coleman Shelton, Greg Gaines, Michael Hoecht, Jamil Demby, JJ Koski, Ben Skowronek, Jeremiah Kolone, Brycen Hopkins, Christian Rozeboom and John Mundt sat down for dinner at 9:30 p.m. and “ordered everything” on the menu, including multiple surf & turfs, endless margaritas and more.

The team then made their way to the club, which was transformed into the “Rams House,” at 12:30 a.m. where they entered to halftime show performer Dr. Dre’s “The Next Episode” and were greeted by customized signage, including a replica of the Lombardi Trophy, the football players, the team’s logo and more.

The Los Angeles Rams continued their post-Super Bowl victory celebrations in Las Vegas Wednesday, enjoying a late-night over-the-top dinner at Casa Playa at Wynn Las Vegas followed by an all-night party at the hotel’s Encore Beach Club at Night, Page Six can exclusively reveal.
“That last drive was a special drive, one I’ll never forget,’’ Rams quarterback Matthew Stafford, who did not go to Vegas, said after the game.
The trip to Vegas came hours after the team celebrated with their victory parade in Los Angeles at the Memorial Coliseum.
We’re also told the large group had multiple VIP tables and celebrated with bottles of vodka, tequila and Champagne.
“Just so happy to get it done,’’ said Stafford, who never won a playoff game in 12 years with the Detroit Lions.
The Rams defeated the Cincinnati Bengals 23-20 in Super Bowl LVI at SoFi Stadium.
At one point, some of the crew joined the Deux Twins in their DJ booth.
